project.name: Hugging Face models
project.notes: This project provides access to over 15,000 neural network models provided by Hugging Face. An API key from huggingface.co (not .com) is required. A free plan provides 30,000 input characters per month. Examples include: * Translate between languages. * Classify text into categories you choose. * Produce a summary of text. * Hold a conversation. * Query a spreadsheet. * Answer a question given a context. * Detect how positive or negative some is. * Find the named entities in some text. * Fill in the blanks.

scene.name: Hugging Face models
scene.notes: This project provides access to over 15,000 neural network models provided by Hugging Face. An API key from huggingface.co (not .com) is required. A free plan provides 30,000 input characters per month. Examples include: * Translate between languages. * Classify text into categories you choose. * Produce a summary of text. * Hold a conversation. * Query a spreadsheet. * Answer a question given a context. * Detect how positive or negative some is. * Find the named entities in some text. * Fill in the blanks.

block-definition.translations: pt:a resposta a _ de _ enviando _ e cabeçalhos _

block-definition.s: Hugging face model %'model name' with key %'api key' $nl with input %'data'
block-definition.comment: Can communicate with over 15,000 models. The API key can be obtained from huggingface.co More information at https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-5.html#hugging-face

custom-block.comment: Send the request to Hugging Face.
Turn the response from JSON to Snap! lists.

block.comment: Check if there is an error

custom-block.comment: If the error is that the model isn't ready then wait.

block.comment: Estimates seem too large so try 1/2

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Reports the character position (starting from 1) of the beginning of the first input string inside the second input string. If it's not found, reports 0.
block-definition.translations: pt:a posição de _ em _ ca:posició de _ en _

block-definition.comment: Reports True if the first input string contains the second input string, otherwise false. Comparison is case-independent by default; use USE CASE-INDEPENDENT COMPARISONS to change that.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ antes de _ ca:text _ conté _ ?

block-definition.comment: Reports the input text with lower case letters instead of capital letters in the input. Uses the user's locale's rules for case conversion.

block-definition.s: text or texts input %'text or texts'
block-definition.comment: Input can either be text or a list of texts.

block-definition.s: get API key of Hugging Face and explain %'explain flag' and ask %'ask flag'

custom-block.l: You need to have an API key from Hugging Face to run this. Your key should be kept secret and not shared. We recommend you read the scripts of this project to be sure your keys will be safe. You can get a key from huggingface.co (not .com)
We can store your key in the browser's local storage. We recommend this only if you are the only user of this computer.

block.l: Enter your key or just press enter if this is a shared computer
OK.Now it is safe to enter your key. It will not be stored.

block-definition.comment: if you entered your Hugging Face API key into the browser's local storage this will remove it.

Input are texts that are potential classes for inputs. (max 10 candidate_labels, for more, simply run multiple requests, results are going to be misleading if using too many candidate labels anyway. If you want to keep the exact same, you can simply run multi label=True and do the scaling on your end. )

block.l: Maximum number of candidate labels is 10. You can run multiple times with different labels and combine the results.

block-definition.comment: If true then classes can overlap.
The minimum length in tokens of the output summary.
The maximum length in tokens of the output summary.
The top tokens considered within the sample operation to create new text.
Define the tokens that are within the sample` operation of text generation. Add tokens in the sample for more probable to least probable until the sum of the probabilities is greater than top p.
The temperature of the sampling operation. Value is between 0 and 100. 1 means regular sampling, 0 means top k=1, 100.0 is getting closer to uniform probability.
The more a token is used within generation the more it is penalized to not be picked in successive generation passes. Value is between 0 and 100.
The maximu amount of time in seconds that the query should take. Network can cause some overhead so it will be a soft limit. Value is between 0 and 120.
Input can either be text or a list of texts.
Input can either be text or a list of texts.

block-definition.s: table as a list of lists of text keys and lists %'table'
question(s) %'question or questions' with context(s) %'context or contexts'
block-definition.comment: This can be used to answer several questions at once. If the first input is a list then the second input should have the same number of text elements.

scripts.comment: Below are examples of using a few of Hugging Face's over 15,000 models. You will need an API token from huggingface.co to run these.

custom-block.l: "inputs":{"question":["What is my name?","Where am I from?","What year was Darwin born?"], "context":["I live near Oxford, was born in Chicago, and am called Ken","I live near Oxford, was born in Chicago, and am called Ken","Charles Darwin and Abraham Lincoln were born on 12 February 1809]}

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.comment: You can just enter text if you have only one text.

scripts.comment: Fills in the blank (indicated by [MASK] in text. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#text2text-generation-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: The web-based Snap! and older desktop-based BYOB have been both developed by Jens Mönig for Windows, OS X and Linux with design ideas and documentation provided by Brian Harvey from University of California, Berkeley and have been used to teach "The Beauty and Joy of Computing" introductory course in computer science for non-CS-major students.

scripts.comment: Finds named enties in some text. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#named-entity-recognition-ner-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

list.l: Some people don't like block-based languages.

custom-block.comment: You can just enter text if you have only one text.

scripts.comment: Reports how positive or negative the text is. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#text-classification-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: He lives near Oxford, was born in Chicago, and is called Ken

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

block.comment: Click to see what table is being queried below.

scripts.comment: The following model takes a query and table and generates an answer. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#table-question-answering-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

list.l: Hi. What do you want to talk about?

scripts.comment: A simple use of DialoGPT-large for a conversation. Note that this should really send only the last few inputs and responses to avoid using up too much of the character input quota.

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: It is Dark Star for sure.

scripts.comment: A version of GPT-2 trained for dialogs. 762M parameters 230 times smaller than GPT-3. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#conversational-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: The most important features that Snap! offers, but Scratch does not, include: * expressions using anonymous functions, represented by a block inside a gray ring, having one or more empty slot(s)/argument(s) that are filled by a "higher order function" (the one that is calling the anonymous one). (Their computer-science theoretical basis is First class functions, which in turn have Lambda calculus as their even more abstract, mathematical, foundation), * lists that are first class (including lists of lists/arrays), * First class sprites (in other words prototype-oriented instance-based classless programming), * "Hyperblocks": functions whose natural domain is scalars (text or numbers), extended to accept lists as inputs and apply the underlying function to the scalars in the list or a sublist, nestable sprites, * codification of Snap! programs to text languages such as Python, JavaScript, C, etc.

custom-block.s: table as a list of lists of text keys and lists %l

scripts.comment: Instead of a spreadsheet you can construct a table as a list of lists and use the following:
Given a context answers a question. More details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#question-answering-task
Translates text from English to Swedish (en-sv) Over 1300 translation models can be found at https://huggingface.co/Helsinki-NLP

Produces a summary of some text. Length, top k, top p, temperature, repetition penality, and maximum time can optionally be controlled as parameters. Details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#summarization-task The example below is copied from Wikipedia.

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: Hi, I recently bought a device from your company but it is not working as advertised and I would like to get reimbursed!

scripts.comment: Given some text and a list of labels this will score how well each label fits the text. If multi-label is true then it predicts the probability that each label is correct. Details at https://api-inference.huggingface.co/docs/curl/html/detailed_parameters.html#zero-shot-classification-task

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.l: This is a "test" of translating from English to French using a model whose name ends in en-fr..

block.l: Look at the scripts by minimzing the stage or clicking 'Edit' in the Projects Explorer.

scripts.comment: Reports the part of speech for each word in a sentence. The tags are described here https://huggingface.co/flair/pos-english

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s
get API key of Hugging Face and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.comment: If you stored your key in the browser's local storage and want to remove it.
